Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Time2travel2places
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a week in February at the Pueblito Escondido condo hotel. We had a one bedroom unit on the first floor looking out on the pool with sliders to access the pool area and the table and chairs on the small patio area directly in front of the unit. The unit was spacious and decorated in a modern style with large shower and a large living area with kitchenette and dining area. TV's with cable in living room and bedroom (only a couple of channels in English though if you do not want to stretch your viewing interests!). The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The Pueblito was a very peaceful place to stay as there was often no one else at the ground floor pool where there were individual lounge chairs and a couple of bed style loungers. Even at the 4th floor common area with the infinity pool, loungers etc, we always found space and usually only a few others there. There are staff constantly cleaning the common areas and maintenance was prompt when we had a couple of issues. As noted by others, the beach is reached in only half a block of sand walkway but not a location to sit on the beach. The walkway splits the Mahekal Resort and their beach chairs and roped off areas take most of the adjacent beach area. There was also a constant sulfurous smell in this beach location that others have noted and I suspect may be due to stagnant water in sand-blocked drain sewers as rain water does not drain from the end of the street nearest the beach. The hotel provided vouchers for free loungers and an umbrella at Mamitas Beach Club (also at the Canibal Royal beach club) which was a comfortable walk along the beach and you can get reasonable snacks and drinks there if you are ok with the booming music. The attached Origenes restaurant had good food for breakfast and dinner and great live music (guitar/singer) at night (if you are over 30 that is - as we are!). Pleasant walk up the street to junction with 5th Av to some bars and restaurants and a mini-market. Then along 5th Av. for about 5 min walk to the main 5th Av action. Great to visit that area but glad we were staying away from it. Taxi to the hotel from the far end of 5th by the Cozumel ferry and bus station was only 50 pesos so very reasonable if you do not want to walk back after a night out.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AMurthy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in December 2011, and had a wonderful time. The location, the quality of the accommodation, the service - everything was excellent. The decor of the rooms was top notch, and felt like a home away from home. The beach was steps away, as were amazing restaurants. Could not have asked for a better experience! Everyone at the hotel was very helpful, and took immediate care of any concerns we had. The kitchen had only the basics, but we were expecting this based on reading prior reviews on TripAdvisor. We were able to get extra pots after a quick call to reception. The grocery store at 38th and 5th had everything you need, plus extremely reasonable rates. Highly recommended. Only con: The wifi was extremely flaky a couple of days

Reviews.Title: “Great non all-inclusive condo”
Reviews.Author: Luis C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is also known as Pueblito Escondido. I needed to stay in a non all-inclusive resort for business near 5th Av. in Playa del Carmen. My business partner brought his young kid and the hotel turned out to be great for both of them as well. The rooms are condo-like, equipped with a kitchenette and fridge. They all have standard kitchen utensils handy and I recommend doing an inventory at check-out just to make sure they don´t charge you for any missing item. Besides the hotel, a small restaurant called Orígenes is open most of the day and night with great food and service, so no problem if you don´t want to cook. Positive Very clean rooms, white pillows and sheets. Excellent furniture, kitchen, TV and DVD equipment. Air conditioning worked great, pools very clean and pool furniture was in excellent condition. Friendly and helpful staff. The hotel is great for bringing young kids since the kitchen allows you to feed them with no hassle and there are good grocery shops near the hotel (three blocks) to buy anything you need. This is an excellent option to save money compared to an all-inclusive if you want to bring all the family. Free in-room wireless internet service. Negative The hotel does not have private beach access, however it is still is one block away. I don't like the public beach near the hotel because of a strange smell and there are not seats and shades. Nearby beach clubs might be good for couples but not the best for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great property friendly service, air conditioning issues”
Reviews.Author: john t
Reviews.Content: To start with we had a great time and this property is BEAUTIFUL! The master bedroom is roomy and the beds are amazingly comfortable. We slept so well. The roof top infinity pool is very impressive and scenic with many lounge chairs around it. Because it's one block from the beach this makes for easy beach access. The staff was friendly and demonstrated good sense of urgency when posed with a problem. Our air conditioning failed on our third day and the room they transferred us to was even hotter. They stated that both units shared the same compressor. Well, finally we were up-graded to a suite that has roof-top access to a private pool. Even though it was a penthouse suite, it was no nicer than our original room. The important thing is that we were again cool. This place is a great value! Our AC issue, although frustrating, took about 2 1/2 hours to resolve. We liked the North Playa location and being on 38th makes it about three blocks North of the 5th Ave. pedestrian walk, but it's a bit removed from the 5th Ave hoopla.

Reviews.Title: “Potential to be great”
Reviews.Author: cinder55
Reviews.Content: As previous reviews have indicated, there are pros/cons to this condo/hotel. The rooms are nice & spacious, close access to the beach, quiet area but yet short walk to restaurants/shopping on 5th Ave. Several of the staff are very friendly but not all - could be more customer service focused. Make sure you make an inventory of all the items in the kitchen, as they are often missing on check-in, and attempts will be made to charge you for items on your check out- you'll need to stand your ground and refuse to pay. The restaurant next door has a great breakfast and the staff there is very nice. The first day we were there was no hot water which previous reviews have mentioned - after that no problems. One of the other guests while we were there was complaining about problems with their toilet and seemed upset. I don't know if we would return as there are other hotels/condos in Playa that are more customer service friendly and not so apt to want to take advantage of their guests. It has the potential to be great due to its location & easy access to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: TBoves
Reviews.Content: If going to Playa del Carmen, I would stay here over any of the overly-expensive all-inclusive resorts. Get a great room right near the beach and you can then enjoy other parts of the town/area without feeling guilty b/c you think you should stay at your resort the whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for what you get”
Reviews.Author: RoxxyGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 10 nights in December over Christmas. It was a similar experience to staying in a Villa with many positive and unfortunately negative aspects. I don't know that any of the negatives were really big enough to not come back (and it certainly didn't hamper our vacation) but they are worth noting. First the good: Room: we were in PH 305, a 2 bdrm, 2 ba duplex with the private pool. This apt was spacious, clean and comfortable for an adult family of 5. The private pool we didn't use as the roof top infinity pool was so beautiful, we opted to use that. The kitchen was fully equipped except for a dishwasher. Free wireless in the room, huge plus. After a week I was stuck in Playa due to a blizzard in NYC so my family left and I stayed a few extra days and switched to room 107- ground floor 1 bdrm that was HUGE, actually bigger living area than the PH. Food: Breakfast was included daily in the restaurant. Service was slow but this was because everything was made fresh to order. It was good food, lots of fresh juices. Location: can't be beat. Steps to the beach and 5th Ave, everything we needed was walking distance. Negatives: major hot water problem in the hotel. We complained the first day. By day 2 when I took a cold shower I was somewhat enraged. They apologized and said it was a boiler issue and they were working on it. By day 3 they shut off the water without warning and it wasn't on again until 6 pm (toilets were not working during this time). Zero water pressure throughout the stay. There were never enough towels in the room. When we asked for more they told us they had to charge us. Um, I don't think so. Some firm albeit polite words had numerous towels in our room 10 min later. Staff was friendly and accommodating so we couldn't fault them on anything, but management is definitely poor. There was no memo, nothing to let us know about the water situation. Once I switched to room 107, the phone was not working. They sent several people to look at it but could never fix it. Normally this wouldn’t be an issue but I had to contact the airline to book a new flight and had to keep going to a pay phone. Some people commented that the staff doesn’t speak English well- they don’t. But you know what? We are in THEIR country and they don't need to speak our language. Practice your Spanish. Beach access: as mentioned, the beach was steps to the hotel. However, please note this hotel doesn't have an immediate area where one can sit with beach loungers/umbrellas. That being said, you have the option of a few beach bars. We had to take a stroll down the beach (turn left on beach and walk down about 5 min) to Canibal Royal- a restaurant/beach club where we could use the chairs etc without a cost. The place was amazing- good DJ and vibe, yummy food (best cerviche and fish tacos). Young/hip staff and everyone was so nice. On Sat it was similar to Nikki Beach- house DJ, def a vibe. Other days it was chill music or they played salsa/meringue, lots of locals. One day we ventured to Mamitas and wow, what a difference. The place was huge, crowded and lacking personal service. However if you sit near the area where they have the beds, it’s also a good crowd and the DJ was pretty great. Overall, we had the feel of a villa with hotel amenities. Unlike staying in a villa where you are self sufficient, you had the room cleaned each day which was nice. On the flip side, there is nothing extra in the apt- cooler for beach, smaller beach chairs, umbrella etc. Also the kitchen didn't have anything if you plan to cook- no salt, pepper, napkins etc. You need to provide everything. Tips: we used Balam Transportation for round trip airport transport and also when we did a day trip. After they picked us up at the airport, we asked to stop by a grocery store where we stocked up on food/water. We did Tulum and Akmal Beach which I would highly recommend. Our driver was professional, on time and wonderful to spend the day with. Overall: this hotel is great if you don't encounter any problems during your trip and its well worth the value. I booked in August and got 30% off the rate so we had a deal. However, its not service oriented and while the staff is very friendly, they are somewhat clueless (we had to call 2x for them to bring a roll away bed and when they finally came, house keeping showed up with a pillow and a sheet, no bed.. Ha ha). The water issue was beyond annoying but what can you do? If I were to get another good rate, I would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: calivea
Reviews.Content: We have been to this hotel twice in the last three years. Ever since our first visit we fell in loved with the area and this hotel. This is not a typical hotel. This is more of an condo building that rents out units as part of the hotel service. As such, there is not fancy lobby, bar, restaurant, which is fine when you are looking for a good place to relax. There are plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance. An the beach is only steps from the hotel. The apartments are outstanding. Fully furnished with modern, high quality and clean furniture. The top floor with the infinity pool and bar are awesome. I definitely recommend it to couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...great value...great location!”
Reviews.Author: orangekoi
Reviews.Content: Prior reviews on this site began to strike fear into the hearts of my husband and I, along with the other two couples we traveled to Playa with in March. I'd booked Pueblito Escondido at the solid recommendation of a friend who frequently travels to Playa, yet mixed reviews here on Trip Advisor had us more than a little concerned. Our fears were completely unfounded, and all in all we enjoyed a fantastic stay here! PROS: location, location, location!!! On the North end, just a mere stone's throw from the beach, and walking distance to 5th Avenue and your choice of restaurants & bars, including the phenomenally cool La Cuevo de la Chango! Very short walk down the beach to the beach clubs; we loved Las Palapas, with their beachfront bar and palapa-style umbrellas. The condo offered tons of space for the money, including a fully-furnished kitchen (yes, with a blender for margarita-making!) I loved the layout of the space, and how the bedroom windows faced an inner open-air hallway, which made for very dark sleeping conditions at night & well into the late morning (of which I am a huge fan!) The resort features contemporary decor, & is kept very, very clean. The rooftop pool is a beautiful space, but the water was just too cold to really enjoy while we were there in March. Pueblito Escondido was a great value for the level of accommodations and such a superb location; we paid $200/night for a Jr Suite booked through Splendia.com, a full $80 less than the official hotel website had charged us. Free wi-fi! CONS: Management is not up to par & seems disorganized in general. While our reservation was on file when we arrived, the hotel had no record of the deposit we'd already paid, or at what rate we had booked our room. Bring printouts of your online confirmations -- you will need them! I honestly don't think that the false charges other reviews are complaining about are malicious or intended...it really seems to be a language barrier and lack of solid bookkeeping that's to blame. (Note that there is an additional room tax on top of the rate, and this was charged to us upon checkout...wondering if some people mistook this for an overpayment?) We had no issues with theft as also mentioned in prior reviews, but we used the in-room safe religiously. It operates differently from most hotel safes I've used, so its entirely possible that other users didn't actually have it locked when they thought they did. Our friends rented a Penthouse suite -- probably not worth the extra money, unless you just need the extra (twin beds only) bedroom. While beautiful, the plunge pools are not at all private, are actually very accessible to anyone at the rooftop pool. We did, however, enjoy their "private" outdoor seating area at night...a lovely spot from which to enjoy sips of our new favorite, Clase Azul tequila! The pool bar was only open one afternoon during our stay, while we were lounging in the cabanas on the roof; very inconsistent bar service available. A Mexican restaurant is now open at ground level of the hotel, but there is still a general lack of amenities, such as fitness center, spa services, etc. I would stay at Pueblito Escondido again without hesitation, but when we return to Playa (and we most definitely will return!), we will probably explore some of the other great lodging options that Playa has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: graveetrain
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here a couple of years ago when it first opened, but since we are planning another trip back I felt the need to write a review of this place. We stayed in a 1-bedroom ground floor room and loved it. The hotel itself was great, rooms were big, the place was quiet, and the rooftop pool and bar were awesome. The service was good except for the early early morning room service knocks. The location of this place is the best part of it all. You are just a few short feet to the beach, and a little stroll to downtown PDC. You are far enough away for noise but close enough to walk everywhere. We were here a week and would not have picked a better location. And there are so many restaurants and bars within walking distance that are fantastic. We loved this place because it was nice enough to spend a day relaxing if we didn't want to leave and close enough to experience other great places in PDC. Next time we go back, this will be on the top of our list.

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Place!”
Reviews.Author: IanCampbell
Reviews.Content: My second stay in Pueblito Escondido. After years of coming to Playa and staying at the noisy south end I am so glad I found this place. Very laid back and quiet, on a pristine stretch of beach away from the madding crowd but close to the action with fun beach clubs 10 minutes in either direction. The condos in this building are huge; we stayed in a one bedroom that basically had 2 living areas plus a dining area with full size dining table. Besides the great beach location the real beauty of this place is the amazing rooftop. It's huge with a bunch of different places to hang out, some in the shade and some in the sun along with the infinity pool. The views from the roof are hard to describe...really breathtaking. Additionally the restaurant downstairs is really good, very creative dishes and super friendly staff. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “they frauded my credit card too!!! otherwise loved it”
Reviews.Author: houtripper
Reviews.Content: we stayed a week..great pool and close to the beach..far from cental town..ferry etc. but the north side is really the best of playa..I payed with my Amex and theydid a second charge approx. $2000 in addition to my biull..Amex took care of it but? Will go back but will watch my credit card!!!

Reviews.Title: “More than a Condo”
Reviews.Author: YairAizenberg
Reviews.Content: We have two children, and didn't want to cram into a small room. We got a 2BR unit on the 2nd floor, with a large balcony overlooking the pool and with peekaboo view of the beach. The unit is BIG and beautifully furnished to a contemporary taste. The hotel is a block from a beautiful beach, and a few blocks from the 5a, so there are many restaurants withing walking distance. The staff was very friendly. They let us borrow a beach umbrella when I told them I couldn't find one to purchase, and stay until 2pm on check-out. The roof-top pool is beautiful, but we couldn't use it because of the kids. The family pool was too cold to our taste, and was barely used by anyone. Room cleaning could have been done better.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: DougQuigalee
Reviews.Content: My wife, 6 year old son and I originally plannned on vacationing with another couple to Playa the week before Thanksgiving. The day before we planned to leave, the other couple was injured in a car accident and we had to postpone our trip to mid-December. In the end, the other couple was unable to attend the trip so three of us ventured down. Bertin in Reservations was completely accomodating and worked with us on the rebooking, honored the current discounts and helped us with waiving the cancellation penalties. We were hoping to stay in penthouse 307, but ended up in 305. The room delivered as promised, the AC worked great and the room was clean and in good condition. We only saw another 2-3 couples during our stay and they all seemed to be staying at Pueblito for the same reason. To stay at a nice hotel, very close to the beach, with great pools, not too far yet not too close to 5th. There were times we felt like we had the run of the place. The staff was incredibly nice and helpful. They helped us with recommendations for cenotes, a rental car, restaurants and a bunch of other things. We enjoyed all the pools, the outdoor shower after the beach and the hotel's proximity to everything (30 secs to the beach, convenience store and Cueva Del Chango restaurant up the street and 5th street a few minutes away). We are currently planning another Mexico trip in 2010 and if we stay in Playa, Pueblito will again be at the top of our list. We experienced none of the negatives others have reported in their reviews. However, the reviews of the restaurants others reviewed were spot on including ALUX (cool place for drinks only), Cueva Del Chango (loved this place) and EL Fogon (great local food, bring a translator). Pueblito Escondido, we were sad to leave you....

Reviews.Title: “We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: FunnyJuggler
Reviews.Content: My Family of Five stayed in one of the suites in early October, and had a great vacation. We had a full kitchen, dinning room, family room, plus two full sized bedrooms - one with a king size bed and en suite for my wife & I, plus another with two twins for the kids. The concierge brought us a roll away for our third child which also fit in the kids room. The kids also claimed the bathroom down the hall for themselves. Our room was clean and modern, and everything functioned well. The kitchen was equipped with basic utensils, but the concierge found us additional pots on request. The maid service was excellent. She cleaned out room very thoroughly each day, and left us with a new piece of towel origami on the bed each day (very impressive). We all made a bee line for Mom & Dad's bed when we returned each day to see what the "new' design was. The pools were clean and well cared for. The onsite parking required that I stop at the lobby, and a security guard would run around to unlock the gated parking garage for us.(Small entrance - I wouldn't want to park a big vehicle there, but our rented PT cruiser fit well) We were there during a quiet season, and the hotel was very quiet - I felt like we had the place to ourselves. As a result, a few services were closed. The cool looking poolside bars at each of the pools never opened, but we brought our own drinks up from our room, and the "problem" was solved. Oct is "rainy season" but in 10 days, we only saw 2 rain storms - both about 5 minutes long. A few other days you could tell it had rained over night, but it never was an inconvenience for us. The wak to the beach is about a minute, and the walk to 5th ave (the touristy hot-spot) is about 5 minutes. I've read the other reviews about mosquitoes, but I rever saw a bug anywhere (1 or two cute small gekos outside in the halls )

Reviews.Title: “Nice value for money but did not deliver as expected.”
Reviews.Author: nameover
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pubelito Escondido for a week in August 2009. After our experience I can say that this hotel seems to be ok but not yet complete. The rooms are ok and you get good value for money (we had booked a penthouse room). However most of the hotel services were not working properly. For instance, there is no restaurant available, only room service. Family pool was closed. Bar at the infinity pool was not fully operative. As we complained to the front desk we were told that the hotel was still being finished and services would be running properly in the future. Although the hotel has a nice beach and is surrounded by a very quit area, it is a 15 minute walk away from the center. This shouldn't be a problem if it wasn't for the 35C temperature. If you are looking for a nice hotel in Playa del Carmen I would definitely recommend going to the Mosquito Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great front desk staff, Hit-or-Miss rooms, POOR management”
Reviews.Author: ratherwelltravelled
Reviews.Content: I arranged for all 65 attendees of my destination wedding to stay at the Pueblito for 3-5 nights in July. We booked the hotel sight unseen, attracted by the newness of the property and the size of the rooms. On the whole, our experience left a bad taste in my mouth. Likes: - The old reservation manager Gloria was professional and competent and managed all of our bookings without a problem (PE now has a new reservation manager Bertin...more later) - The property was clean and quiet. The pools were well maintained and the view is as good as advertised. - The beach is closer than advertised...literally across the street. The beach clubs are easily accessible and the beach is gorgeous. The heart of Playa is somewhat of a hike, but not inconvenient. - The front-desk staff was always helpful and friendly, even when dealing with our many problems with the rooms. Dislikes - Our room was filled with mosquitoes. I should have been tipped off by the small dried blood marks on the couch from previous victims. We got 4-5 new bites a night as we slept. I wasted a lot of time trying to kill them. I thought all rooms were like ours, but learned later that wasn't the case. Maybe it was our room's proximity to the pool? We stayed in 102. I felt lucky to not have swollen bites on my face during the wedding. - Stuff not working. Our room was fine in this regard, but many of my guests had problems and I felt responsibility to deal with them as the host. One room smelled of sewage and was uninhabitable. Multiple rooms had ineffective A/C, and the older guests in my party were not comfortable. My guests uncovered and reported these problems upon check-in, and some were never resolved satisfactorily during our stay. I wasted many hours dealing with these issues. My expectation is that all the rooms would have working A/C and be checked for foul plumbing problems BEFORE our checking in. I also hoped for a more hands-on/interactive approach to fixing these things once we identified them. The hotel became an unnecessary distraction that only added to the stress of hosting a destination wedding. - Billing. The reservation manager Bertin promised one group of our guests, who were forced to cram 8 to a room due to the sewage problem, a discount on the "extra persons" charge. Really? An "extra persons" charge when the original room was uninhabitable? Well he wasn't available to confirm the "discount" when that group checked out, so they were forced to pay it with the understanding that Bertin would resolve the issue later. We had confidence that he would make good on his promise. About one month and 10 emails later from both myself and the paying guest, and he's stopped responding altogether. Hiding from your customers is not a good way to make an impression, and neither is breaking promises. In short, I can't recommend the Pueblito Escondido. I would have rated them average if they did nothing else beyond provide basic service and rooms. But I have to consider the amount of time I spent dealing with room issues, the inconveniencing of my guests, and the lack of communication over their incorrect charges that I'm still dealing with one month later. You can find better.

Reviews.Title: “A very relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: roxym222
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Pueblito Escondito during our first visit to Playa del Carmen. We got a great deal on the hotel and flight package, I think we paid $1000 for 2 roundtrip tickets from Florida plus 4 nights at Pueblito from Orbitz.com. We ended up getting a large suite with two big flatscreen TVs, a large living room area, dining room, full kitchen and a decent sized bathroom as well as a balcony facing the beach. We're no snobs by any means, but after looking at the other reviews too I have to admit that there was a slight musky smell in the living room, but that didn't really put a damper on our mood. Everything else was great. The service was good considering they're mostly a timeshare condominium with minimal concierge service, the rooftop pool bar was great, and the location was perfect-just a few steps from the beach and really close to downtown Playa del Carmen. Overall, for the price we paid I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a relaxing, comfortable resort to stay at that's close enough to the party scene but not necessarily on top of it.

Reviews.Title: “Poor management and operations”
Reviews.Author: milayit
Reviews.Content: My sister got married in PDC and all the guests stayed at Pueblito Escondido. We had about 19 rooms booked over the course of 5 days. There were several problems some of which were not resolved and many of the guests were inconvenienced. Room 3xx: Major plumbing issue with sewage overflowing. Never fixed and another penthouse was not available so occupants had to stay in other guests’ rooms for the entire stay. Was told a discount would be applied to the rooms they ended up staying in but that has not yet happened. Room: 204: Despite booking a master suite, they were told none were available and given a Jr suite. 2 ppl stayed in the Jr suite and 2 others had to stay in rooms of the other guests. Upon checkout, they were still charged for a master suite (finally resolved) and were told they would get a discount for the inconvenience but that has not happened. Room 311: A/C leaking in master bathroom and damaged some of guests’ things on the bathroom counter and floor. Room 206: Despite booking a master suite, they were first given a Jr suite. Finally moved to correct room but a/c in was not working. Room 301: No hot water (fixed in 1 day) Room 216: No water pressure and no hot water (fixed 2 days later) Room 213: Toilet and a/c not working (fixed in 1 day) I am still waiting to hear from the hotel about the discounts on 2 of the rooms. Despite all the problems, Bertin, the manager on-site was very helpful. He also helped arrange a brunch on Sunday morning of coffee, juice, fruit and churros.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: cbarnes517
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at Pueblito Escondido for 10 days to celebrate our 25th anniversary. We stayed in a one bedroom which we had booked directly through the owner on VRBO.com. It was much cheaper than going through the condo itself. The scenery from the roof top pool is so beautiful and amazing it's hard to put into words. It is picture perfect. The rooms were clean and had all you would need for a stay away from home. The beach is only steps away and not crowded. The sand is beautiful and the ocean is amazing. There are many colors of blues and greens. The beach was clean and we enjoyed watching the people, swimming in the ocean and just basking in the sun. Pueblito Escondido is on the quiet end of town but definitely within walking distance to many things. We like to walk and even with the high temps. of 80's and 90's and very humid, we were able to walk everywhere. There is a little convenience store near the condo for quick trips for drinks and other grocery items. There is also a laundry mat near the store if you need to do laundry on a long stay. It was only 25 pesos for the washer and 20 pesos for the dryer. A few blocks away is also the Mega Store - like a Wal-Mart where we did our grocery shopping. Very reasonable prices there. We took a cab back to the condo due to the distance and heavy bags. We walked to 5th ave. which is filled with little shops for T-shirts, jewelry, liquor, pharmacy and Mexican crafts. Also along 5th ave. are many restaurants to choose from. It is a fun place to visit and we will definitely go back to Playa and stay at Pueblito Escondido

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Condo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rasvideo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Playa three times in the last 12 months. The first two times we stayed in all inclusives, Royal Hideaway and Riu Palace Mexico in Playacar. We had great vacations but found that we were missing great opportunities to sample the restaurants and lively atmosphere of Playa Del Carmen. We wanted to be on the quieter North side of town but a short walk to the action of 5th avenue. We also wante the beach. This hotel was perfect. We were upgraded from a studio to a 2 bedroom. The rooms are contemporary and beautiful. Everything worked perfectly and the daily maid service was excellent. You can not beat the roof top infinity pool. Quiet but just enough quests for some pleasant conversations. There was something wrong with the pool filter system for two of the days but they fixed it. No big deal because you are steps from the beach and there is a nice shower on the path back into the property. We had a great time. Breakfast every morning at Cuervo Del Chango was soooo good. We highly recommend if you want to have everything but explore the dining and emntertainment options that surround this city.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing, upscale, quiet resort”
Reviews.Author: jphaus
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay at Pueblito Escondido. We got a penthouse suite, which was more than enough room for 2 of us. As others have mentioned, the rooftop pool is not very private, nor is it big, but it is still nice to have right outside your room if you can afford the upgrade. There is plenty of seating up there as well. There are even electrical outlets, which allowed us to watch a movie outside one night one our portable DVD player and take in the cool night breeze. As others note, the rooftop pool has the best views. Arturo, the bartender, was friendly and made very good drinks (expect "resort" prices). We were not bothered by the music on the roof as others have mentioned. We did not use the ground level pool at all, but it looked nice. The room itself was nicely accommodated, with housekeeping performed daily (usually around 2:00 for us). Our maid was friendly and went out of her way to make us towel animals and clean our dirty dishes in the kitchen sink each day (make sure you leave her a tip). The only snafu we ran into was that our air conditioner started leaking on our last night there. There was a lot of water coming into the master bathroom area from above the ceiling. It was around 10:00pm and the front desk did not have any maintenance people around to come take a look at it. They did offer to have housekeeping come and clean up the water, but the only solution they offered was to turn up the A/C so that it would not freeze up (sounds like this has happened before). It got pretty warm in the room without the A/C, and had it not been our last night we probably would have been more upset with the way it was handled. However, I have no doubt they would have been more responsive had it been a decent hour of the day. The location was great. So close to the beach, and about 10 minutes from the main section of 5th Ave. We enjoyed the extra walk as a good way to burn off those dinner calories and to see more of the town. We always felt safe on the walk, and they were installing extra lighting along 38th as we were there which should make it even better. There are plenty of convenience stores near the hotel for stocking up your fridge with snacks and drinks. The Mega is not all that far away either and probably has better prices. We did not try the hotel's Italian restaurant, but it was pretty dead the entire week we were there. No more than one or two tables occupied every night. It had a nice atmosphere, but we just preferred to go out closer to town. All-in-all, a great trip. Although a little north of all the action, this part of town seems to be newer and will likely be just as active in a few short years.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: LoveBaja
Reviews.Content: We were blown away by this place. We got the 3rd-floor suite with the roof-top pool and our jaws dropped when we walked in! Gorgeous suite with top-notch furnishings and decor. I keep reading reviews where guests criticize this property for mosquitos. We never saw one nor have we any of the other half-dozen times we've gone to Playa. Either way, what does this have to do with the quality of this location? Absurd! We had the same maid the whole eight days and she was thorough and never in the way. In fact, we felt she went out of her way to accomodate our schedule. The front desk staff was also kind and extremely helpful with advice and finding and contacting local businesses. They even gave us a 4pm checkout on our last day so we could hang out at the beach before catching our red-eye. As for location, I would give it a 9. The only way it could be better is if it were right on the beach instead of 50' from it! Our entire family highly recommends this property and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “First place where the photos online actually look like the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: reddrgnfly
Reviews.Content: We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and of all the places we saw in Playa (always want to make sure we made the right choice); this is the place we would actually stay at again. This hotel is very beautiful and perfect if you DON'T want to be right in the middle of downtown Playa. We were looking for a quiet location within walking distance to the main part of town and this was an excellent option. We rented a penthouse as a treat for my husband's 40th and it was nicely decorated with a kitchenette, two bedrooms and bathrooms, two plasma TVs, DVD player, dining area and a rooftop deck/pool. The rooftop area is not 100% private, as it is connected to the infinity pool/bar area and all residents are able to go up there; however it was still nice and quiet and the infinity pool is the best place to be anyway (best views!). We wouldn't really recommend the penthouse to a group of people as the setup was a little odd...you enter the penthouse through the first bedroom and therefore there would be little privacy if you were not all on the same schedule. The staff was very nice, but you have to ask a few times to get what you need. The beach is about 200 feet away and is cleaner and less crowded than the downtown Playa area. It's about a mile walk downtown or a 20-30 peso taxi ride (depending on who you get and how much you want to argue). There are some nice places to eat right around the hotel (La Cueva Del Chango-best breakfast, seriously; Kool Fish-get the chipotle fish tacos) and the hotel caters from an Italian place around the corner (dinner here was alright-nothing spectacular; pizza's looked good, but we didn't try them). Overall, this is a great place to stay if you want something clean, quiet and close to the beach without being right in the heart of town. Worth the walk and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Shady, Shady, Shady Place - Go Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: BiscuitSM
Reviews.Content: While a nice hotel, the management at P.E. is so shady, I'll never return. After pre-paying 5 months in advance for an entire weekend, they had the driver pick us up at the airport and take us directly to a DIFFERENT hotel. This is because they over-sold the P.E. and decided that we had to be the group to get sent somewhere else. Assuming (wrongly) that we didn't speak Spanish, they thought we'd just go along with it. Well, the other hotel was nice, but TOTALLY EMPTY. It wasn't even finished yet - plaster was still on the walls, there were no amenities open, it was absurd. They insisted that there wasn't room at the P.E. when we asked them about all of this. They couldn't explain why we were the one group to lose our room, even though we pre-paid and reserved well in advance. We eventually figured something out with a partial refund, but it's been 3 weeks and I still haven't seen it hit my credit card. SHADY! I strongly recommend against ever using Pueblito Escondido - they'll try to take you for all they can!

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation In Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: RickTheTraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have a toddler and wanted to take a family trip to Mexico. Our main concern was getting a nonstop flight from Los Angeles to some fun and warm destination. After an extensive review of exciting yet affordable destinations, Playa Del Carmen (“PDC”) became the most likely choice. Just 40 minutes (with traffic) south of Cancun, this resort Riviera differs from so many of the Mexican resort towns by having a more European flavor to it. If you are looking for “Senior Frogs Bar” and getting plastered over cheep Tequila then you may want to go Cabo San Lucas (West Coast) or Cancun (East Coast) where you will certainly find the typical American college brothels to get wasted at. However PDC has a unique mix of elegant young hip and somewhat posh Europeans and Argentineans….beautiful and trendy. A cross between the French Riviera (St. Tropez) with possibly Barcelona meets the Greek Islands! Pueblito Escondido was truly the best choice we could have selected. We checked out other hotels while we were there and confirmed that our choice was the right one, unless you are willing to spend $1,600 per night for the Mandarin Orient hotel (which is really nice). In fact we will be going back there to Pueblito Escondido again soon. It is a “Condominium Hotel” that combines a fully furnished apartment lifestyle and amenities with a full service hotel. The building exterior design is nice (not exactly my style though), while the interiors are really well designed with modern pieces (my style). It is finished and furnished like a Four Season hotel while rented out at very reasonable rates. The best 1-bedrooms to get are #102 & 103 because they have direct access to the family pool, while #202 & 203 have ocean views, and #302 & 303 have direct roof access to their own private pool and roof deck lounge (totally not worth it). For a 2-bedroom avoid #105 & 106, 205 & 206, 305 & 306, which face the hotel building itself and offers no views. All others are fine. As a side note, the Penthouse units with the private pools are really nice but not worth the money simply because they are not very private and are integrated to the rooftop pool. So it may not be worth the extra money. See photos. The apartments are relatively clean (not as clean as a Four Seasons but clean enough), and are well equipped with everything you possibly could ask for. You can ask the front desk to provide you anything else you may be missing. The management was great (the onsite manager is a beautiful kind and professional lady) so was the front desk staff. The hotel includes about 40-units, so it is small and quaint. Always quiet, clean and well kept. In fact all the reviews said that it is quiet and we only saw another couple once by the family pool although the place was fully occupied. The hotel is right by the beach and most people spend their time at the beach (by the way, the beach is literary across the sand alley, where the guest of other hotels hang out anyway). The beach is very nice, quiet and clean. Bring your kiteboarding or windsurfing equipment if you have it because it is windy between November and May. Windy enough to enjoy a good kiting session but not too windy that beach goers can’t sit and enjoy the sand. Pueblito Escondido has three pools, two on the ground floor (one is a shallow toddlers pool), and a third is on the roof. All the reviews I read raved about that rooftop pool……well yet again words can’t describe how awesome that rooftop pool is. It is all that rave and some more. It is a very trendy roof top with an infinity pool and walk up wet pool bar. A whole bunch of daybeds and a lounge area overlooking PDC bay. For those that have been to the Sky Bar in Los Angeles, or the Shore Club or Delano Hotels in Miami, or Nikki Beach anywhere…well it has that feeling but it just sits on top of a four story building with unobstructed views. See photos below. There is a full service bar and a live DJ mixing the right mood music to accompany your relaxing stay from 10:30 AM to 6:00 PM. Drinks are reasonably priced. There is NO restaurant associated with the hotel (except for the rooftop bar which serves beverages only), but the hotel building has an Italian restaurant attached to its’ street level, as well as a hand full of restaurants within a 1-minute walking distance. Parking is plenty and free. The area feels safe and well lit. The building has its own 24-hour security and there is plenty of security across the alley at the Shangri-la Hotel. Finally, the hotel is within a 5-10 minute safe walking distance to 5th Avenue where most of the restaurants, cafes and bars are. That Avenue is for pedestrians only and extends out 40-blocks (yes that is FOUR ZERO). The hotel is at the northerly end of the Avenue by 38th Street, while the highest end section is around 16th Street, with excellent restaurants and bars. The area gets a little touristy around 6th street. I hope my review of this hotel is helpful, which I thought was good for anybody that wants space and independence be it families with kids, romantic couples, adults, etc.

Reviews.Title: “New and Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: kwclan
Reviews.Content: We loved it! We stayed in the penthouse for a girlfriend getaway. My 3 friends and I really enjoyed this hotel. Having been to Playa before, I was not sure if this hotel might be too far from the action on 5th ave., but it worked out great. We took cabs into town at night because we were going to Calle 10. Every night the cab ride was a different price, but should be $4-5 which we had no problem with. PE is located in the newest, (soon to be) more upscale area of Playa, I can only imagine what it will look like in1- 2 years. There is a grocery store really close which we visited everyday, comedy really. But as far as the hotel goes PROs Brand new, clean lines, comfy beds, nice upscale bathrooms, beautiful infinity pool and gorgeous rooftop area. Cons which wouldn't deter me from staying here...no view from #312, except the meditation center, water pressure is a little weak, didn't think the music at the pool would bother me, but it was mildly annoying, and overall, there were very few people around the hotel, we did not even have a drink there. If you are going for a "resort" time, pick another place, if you are going for peace,relaxation, romance or have your own fun..you'll love this place. Location to the beach is perfect, there are wonderful restaurants and coffee houses nearby including starbucks, but the best coffee of my life was at the cafe behind the new sushi bar. try the granola, yogurt and fresh fruit there too! We'll be back there next year, but heading to the gran porto real with the family in 2 weeks!

Reviews.Title: “Roomy & Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: IdahoKat
Reviews.Content: Pueblito Escondido is in an excellent location by the beautiful beach and an easy walk to 5th Avenue. The condo was large which made our stay with our two older children easy. We were not in each other's ways. The bathroom had two entrances - very handy and more private. It was a large bright bathroom. The condo was nicely decorated as well. The front desk staff as well as all other staff were friendly and helpful. The rooftop pool area was fantastic! The view was amazing as well. We spent most of our time at the rooftop pool. It was too bad that the condo management did not enforce the "adults only" rule even after being asked. Sometimes children were running around and It became noisy. We did not avail ourselves to the bar because we brought our own drinks in a small ice chest. The condo was beautiful but the furniture setup was awkward. It was difficult for all of us to watch the TV at the same time. We really weren't able to do it, actually because of the furniture. Take a look at the condo complex's website to see what is meant. The shower had very poor pressure and was too high on the wall. Water sprayed all over and went under the shower door. The floor was a mess many times after a shower even after the maintenance staff cleaned out the shower head. The kitchen faucet came off at times and gave us a little shower. It was easily put back on with no harm done. It was just an annoyance. We wished that there were kitchen towels available since the dishes were hand-washed. There was plenty of dish soap available. The most disappointing element of the condo was the horrible smell that came from the restaurant on the ground floor. (The restaurant was closed for the first half of our stay and then opened after Christmas.) It made the condo smell with no relief. We asked for help and there appeared to be no remedy. It remained smelly for the last three or four days of our visit. Opening the sliding doors did not help. The internet worked most of the time and met our needs. It was nice to keep up on the rest of the world. The TV worked well with both Spanish and English stations. Taxis were always available and the drivers were friendly and helpful. Also, the morning coffee pot near the main desk was a nice touch. We appreciated having a large starter bottle of water as well.

Reviews.Title: “Pertinent Information Not Luxury Condo, but average”
Reviews.Author: MarinaWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: First off I am already sold on Playa Del Carmen. The area is fantastic. The location of this condo hotel is superior. For the past 3 years we have stayed in and around it. We watched Pueblito being built and had great expectations about being able to stay there this year. The reservation making experience was fine. Ms. Ramirez is cordial and all aspects of our reservation matched our saturday arrival. The clerk on check in..name Carmen..was not able to communicate very well with us...we went to our room...and sadly it was very dirty...hair on the floors, furntiture dirty and blood on the bedroom wall. I went back to the desk and requested a room move or that something be done about the room quality...this was met with an inability to get things sorted out until Diego arrived an hour later. Diego quickly organized a cleaning crew to fix up my concerns...but the condition of the Hotel is quickly deteriorating..very sad. In unit 103 the patio doors are broken and there is mold on the ceiling of the shower. This was pointed out by another guest on trip advisor and not resolved. I bought bleach showing them how to correct the problem and it was never attended to...The furniture pool side is stained and the furniture within the suite had many stains on it. There are virtually no amentities in the kitchen..no toaster..but there is a microwave, fridge and stove and coffee maker. Sadly there are no oven mits and we had to buy them and a dish towel. There is no dish soap. The pools are not heated but the ocean water is fabulous. I want to provide some real information for you...If you shop you should go to Chedraui..pronounced shed rau eee...you get the best choices and best prices there. go to the one at the playas americana mall...the daily cleaning service is nice but washing dishes is extra so buy some dish soap...sheets are changed daily along with towels...bring your own hair conditioner as there isnt any supplied...no hair dryer in suite, towels are of poor quality and this is not a luxury condo experience. i want to be clear to those who travel alot and have high expectations..this isnt a luxury experience. It is a beautifully designed complex but deteriorating fast. Watch you r bill on check out as we had someone elses bar charges on ours..they did taken them off but not the taxes associated with them I noticed later...the bed is reasonably comfortable if you like a hard mattress..the drapes do not cover the bedroom windows very well and so if you like the room dark this is a problem...Thank goodness for Diego at the front desk who looked after us...the other staff are friendly but language barrier for non spanish speakers is the problem...in room tv is nice...reasonable water coming out of the shower head... I would encourage you to check the kitchen stock on arrival. Our coffee pot was broken and we would have been charged for it on check out if I had not had it switched...check all of the kitchen wares on arrival...

Reviews.Title: “Pueblito is a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: PlayaChicago
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this property this past October to celebrate our 5-year wedding anniversary (booked with Orbitz.com). It was a perfect choice for us! We have stayed in Playa several times in all different areas of the city. By far, this is now our favorite location. We fell in love with the Mamitas beach area and our favorite breakfast place La Cueva del Chango years ago so this hotels proximity to both could not have been better. Even though Pueblito does not have ocean front rooms, the rooftop pool has priceless beach & full ocean views and the sand literally spills onto the steps of the property so you really are “on the beach”. We booked a junior suite, which we loved, & stocked up our kitchen at the very convenient Mega store just a couple blocks away (very short and cheap cab ride; to get a cab back, go downstairs in Mega and in the back entrance cabs line up). The bed was extremely comfortable, as others have commented on & we always had plenty of towels even considering that we used them for the pool daily. The rooftop pool really is incredible. The chairs/beds/music/view….all perfection for us. The only area of the property we did not try out was the restaurant as it was closed when we visited. If you have never been to Playa, you should know a little about this resorts location. It is on the north side of Playa which years ago was very sleepy and from our perspective, not so nice. We only used to go that far north because of the beach & breakfast place as I stated before. Now, the famous 5th avenue pedestrian road has almost spread as far north as Pueblito. So now, you have awesome beaches on one side and just a short walk away you have every restaurant and bar you could imagine as they are spreading more and more to the north. The area still has a residential and more laid-back feeling than the developed and established resort areas to the south – we really were able to get a feeling for how it would be to actually buy a condo and live there. There are so many great restaurants in Playa it is hard to recommend which ones to choose…just walk around, look at menus and go where you feel drawn. I cannot think of one really bad meal we have ever had. The prices aren’t necessarily cheap right on 5th but we still seem to find better prices than we do in Chicago overall - just go when there is a really good exchange rate and ALWAYS change your dollars and pay in pesos EVERYWHERE. The one place I will recommend to stay clear of when you’re planning your day trips is Xel-Ha. Disappointing to say the least. If you want to snorkel, book a trip with Fat Cat Catamaran. If you want to see ruins, rent a car, take the bus, or catch a cab to Tulum (take swimsuits, bottled water, and a hat). If you want to learn more about the areas history and culture, go to Xcaret and make sure to stay through the evening performances and take the time to go through both of the underground rivers. Overall, yes, you should stay at Pueblito Escondido and yes, you will love your Playa vacation!

Reviews.Title: “First time at Pueblito/Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: brainbckt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I rented a Junior Suite at Pueblito Escondido in late October. This was our first visit to Playa del Carmen. My comments will echo many of those already noted in previous reviews. POSITIVES: Pueblito Escondido was a good value; spacious accomodations, newer property, contemporary furnishings, nice rooftop pool, good proximity to the action on 5th Avenue, but also far enough away from the crowds to be a quiet locale. If you're going as a couple, unless you have money to burn, I wouldn't splurge for the Penthouse Suite. As others have noted, the plunge pools are clustered around the main rooftop pool and aren't really private. Plus, as I mentioned before, the Junior Suites are plenty spacious. Service from the staff was efficient and friendly. We seem to be two of the few guests, so we pretty much had the place (including the pool) to ourselves. NEGATIVES: As others have noted, the kitchen was poorly appointed. No dish soap, paper towels or corkscrew. Suite had a musty smell; noticed some mold on shower ceiling. Comforter was stained (nail polish? blood?). Eurodisco music at rooftop pool was a mild annoyance. OTHER COMMENTS: Property is a stone's throw from the beach (half block). Walk out to the beach, hang a right and walk 5 minutes to Kool Beach Club. Chair/umbrella was about 6 bucks per. Drink/food service was fast/friendly, prices were very reasonable and we found the food to be surprisingly good. On the subject of food, I would highly recommend Babe's for Thai (we ate there 3 times...make sure you try one of their towering margaritas) and El Fogon for authentic Mexican (one of the best meals I've ever had and dirt cheap). We had breakfast and 2 lunches at La Cueva del Chango, which is a few steps away from Pueblito. Good food, cool atmosphere and appears to draw a lot of locals. 100% Natural on 5th Avenue is also recommended for breakfast. We had room service pizza the night of arrival and it was very good (delivered from a pizza joint across the street). Finally, we tried Carboncitos, which is rated no. 1 here on trip advisor. We really didn't see what the fuss was about. Food was decent, but nothing to rave about. We had a much better meal at El Fogon (be warned: as others have noted, El Fogon is a dump and a few blocks back from the tourist area...menus are in Spanish and waitress didn't speak English...still, if you're a little adventurous, the food is fantastic). Overall, we found Playa del Carmen a nice alternative to the Americanized, drunken frat boy scene of Cancun. The crowd, at least this time of year, seemed to skew 30s-40s, and included a mix of Americans, Europeans and Mexicans. Granted, Playa can be tourist-y, especially on parts of 5th Avenue, but it nevertheless hasn't been scrubbed and "Disney-fied" like Cancun. Pueblito Escondido is a nice option for travellers who want to get out and look around, vs. being sequestered in a resort compound where you never leave the grounds.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: AxelFrance
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in this hotel for 12 days both in a junior suite and a penthouse (with private plunge pool). The suites: They are very large with a very nice modern furniture. I think the junior suite has enough room for a couple. We were in 102 on the first floor with a terrace just steps away from the "familly pool". I guess 101 to 104 have the best location. The penthouse has one extra bedroom. Beware: when you look at the pictures on their website you have the feeling that the roof terrace and plunge pool are private. In fact there is no privacy at all especially 301 and 303: their pool is right next to the infinity pool. As we were already on site in our junior suite we were able to choose our penthouse (after a little argument with the staff). We chose 307 witch is one of the most private with an excellent sea view+++. However as the hotel is so close to this very nice and quiet beach we didn't use a lot the plunge pool. The beach: Instead of going on the right arriving on the sand to the beach club we preffered walking up left 10 minutes to a very quiet spot with almost nobody (and thankfully no music). The resort: Nothing to complain about it. It's brand new and the staff is friendly. The infinity pool on the 4th floor is Whouah! Almost nobody except the bartender. Didn't really appreciate the music though. The location: It's on the north end of the touristic Playa so it's not crowed and quite calm. On the other hand you have to walk a good 20 minutes to get to the south area of 5th ave. That was OK with us because a calm and not crowed beach was our main criteria. Go check the distance on google earth, the hotel is next to the blue one behind Shangri La Caribe. I was really disaponited by the food in restaurants in Playa: not good and quite expensive. We were not impressed by the Cueva Del Chengo but didn't have a breakfast there as we had it in our room (the kitchen is fully equipped). Don't take a cocktail in a restaurant (almost no alcohol inside) they're much better in the lounge bars. Overall: I would definitly recommend this hotel and go back there. I would stay in a junior suite as it is cheaper and the private pool is a little bit useless with such a wonderfull infinity pool and the proximity of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms near the beach”
Reviews.Author: avb13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pueblito Escondido Resort for five days in June. I choose the resort for location, the roof top pool, price and the services we desired for this part of our holiday. The location was fantastic just a short walk from a beautiful part of the beach five minutes from several beach clubs. Since we hired a car it was no problem to be in the "little italy" section of Playa a bit away from the busier part of 5th Ave. There are quite a few good restaurants nearby and an easy walk to reach the action on 5th. One of our favorites was a little coffe shop called Coffee Cafe, really good coffee and great musice They also had internet sevice if needed. We stayed in a Penthouse two bedroom apartment, room 301. The rooms were spacious and well laid out. A flat screen tv was in the living room and bedroom. The sofa in the living room is not the most comfortable I have ever sat on, but not bad. We did not have any problems with the bed post being in the way of the tv in the bedroom, as others have mentioned. They offer lots of channels in spanish a quite a few in english. We didn't watch much tv, just a few times when it rained. Free internet service was provided as well. The kitchen had a large fridge freezer, but not much in the way of bowls or utensils. I thought it rather strange they did not have any wine glasses at all. But, maybe most people drink tequila while in Mexico. However, we love our wine and champers so our request for glasses was promptly met. The main shower was large with good pressure. The closet had drawers and plently of hanging space. Although the closet rail is a bit high. They also supplied an iron and ironing board. However no hair drier. There was also an inroom safe. We had a problem with it at first, but my husband discoverd the batteries needed replacing, this was taken care of for us at once. Our private roof top pool was fantastic and we would use the pool when coming back from the beach or one of our excursions at the end of the day. Perfect. Well, one time there was another couple in the pool when I came up with my drink and towel. I guess they thought if they could get away with it, why not. The private pools are quite close to the main pool and there is easy access. I liked having our own space and didn't mind paying a little extra for it. The roof top pool had a great view and a swim up bar. We didn't mind the lack of shade at the private pool, but an unbrella probably would't go amiss. The air conditioning worked very well keeping the rooms cool. We also had a small balcony with a view of the sea, but there were no tables or chairs on it. The front desk was very helpful upon check in. As were all of the staff we dealt with. I would say my only complaint was the irregularity of the towels they left for you. There never seemed to be the same amount or no beach towels left. Other than that it suited our purposes very well and I would recommend this property to our friends. We did not use the pool bar or the any room service offered.

Reviews.Title: “Very much underrated”
Reviews.Author: palapa_man
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Playa and our stay at Pueblito Escondido. We had previously stayed at La Tortuga, (about 20 blocks south)which we had thoroughly enjoyed, in January of this year. We found Pueblito Escondido to be superior in almost all ways, and less expensive. The room we had, first floor junior suite with King bed was really nice. The one point that did not come across in previous reviews is proximity to the beach, just steps away, and the beach clubs are best reached by simply walking down the beach, first Mamitas, then Kool. Both had advantages, but Mamitas filled up earlier, especially in January when we were here previously. Kool has more comfortable(padded) chairs, but was about $6 per chair compared to $2 at Mamitas, try them both, and decide for yourself. The restaraunts near the hotel were more reasonable, and I felt better. I must say that the eateries in the mid to south portions of 5th Avenue were overpriced and commercialized. The Italian restaraunt around the street from hotel, will be moving into the restaraunt space at Pueblito recently vacated. We ate at this eatery twice, they also deliver to hotel, thought the food was good, I shared a tequila with owner as I waited for my takeout order. Babes on 5th was very good, the blueberry margeurita is huge, you can definitely share one. Stopped at La Vagabunda about 6-8 blocks down on 5th and had a nice lunch of fish tacos, pretty good. La Cueva del Chenga was nice for breakfast, it is 50 yards from hotel, we ate there twice, and also returned to La Tortuga for breakfast one day, we really enjoyed breakfast there when we stayed in January, we saw the waiters and they definitely remembered us, they were super friendly during our stay. We arranged transfers thru the hotel but they were actually less than the amount we were quoted by e-mail from the front desk. We paid $60 to Playa and $50 back to airport. We toyed with idea of taking the "air conditioned luxury bus" and then a cab to hotel from bus station , but I was in a rush to get there. The endless pool on the 4th floor was incredible, see for yourself that the pictures do not do it justice, you see the water, Cozumel, cruise ships, it was awesome. The bar is open til 6 pm, most days and closed on Monday. We brought our own bottle of champagne in the absence of bartender, who was good and made a nice drink-no low end liquor used here, all drinks were billed to room with a signature. There is also a pool on the first floor, we had a nice view of it from our room. Both pools were at times empty. We did manage to meet some nice people at the adult pool on the 4th floor, (LA, Denver, Dallas, New York, and New Jersey) The front desk was very helpful with all of our requests, ice, (there is an ice maker in the freezer, good luck) a blow dryer, extra towels, I just made sure to always tip the person who delivered item(s). In summary, this hotel was a bargain, I would recommend to friend and family. I can see minor details, such as the location of the 40" LG television, but how many people have a TV this size in their hotel room, there was also a 15" in bedroom, and we did not have any problem with viewing from bed. We moved the two ottomans to the loveseat by TV and they stayed there for our entire stay, I would definitely return, but it may be a year or two, as we have been here twice this year. We booked thru Orbitz, they had the lowest prices of major websites and the hotel website. Purchased some liquor at Cancun airport on arrival, never thought to do this before, nice savings, remember, there is a fridge and blender in room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: jpdilly
Reviews.Content: Amazing Condo! Very spacious and modern design. Rooftop adult only infinnity pool to die for! Walk in closet area, huge shower! Very helpful staff who spoke good English. Right next to Shangri La Hotel on wide stretch of white sand beach. Very quiet end of Playa. Would stay here again without hesitation!!! (Only improvements could be the lack of kitchen equipment...need a baking dish, more frying pans, wine opener, etc.) Walmart is a 35 peso taxi ride away. Quick walk to 5th avenue where all the great restaurants and bars are. Must do Altournative Mayan Encounter tour while in Playa!!
